Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis, Genesis 2.3.1 rolls out ahead of WordPress 4.6 (update now!), six ethical ways to earn money with someone else’s WordPress themes, and a new Genesis podcast.

Genesis 2.3.1 rolls out, update now

First up, a small but important update to Genesis this week which fixes a compatibility bug with WordPress 4.6, which is expected to be released mid August. But don’t delay, update to v2.3.1 today so you’re ready.

Genesis 2.3.1 Now Available (a small, but necessary update) — https://t.co/waHZUAF6eL #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/f854SdrZC7

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) August 2, 2016

Showcase

There are so many good sites in the showcase this week, but I’ll start with this new one from Ryan Townley (creator of Minimal Genesis) for jjohnstoninsurance.com

Just launched a new #genesiswp site for a local insurance agency: https://t.co/eavdElCPlm pic.twitter.com/IrxdthGeal

— Ryan Townley (@ryantownley) August 4, 2016

Next up Shaan Nicol over at Chilly Bin Design with a new site for… chillybin.com.sg!

And we’re live! A new chillybin #genesiswp site using #bfg from @cdukes. Inspiration from all over, so happy! pic.twitter.com/SA1Bm1tAw5

— ChillyBin Web Design (@chillybindesign) August 4, 2016

Next, two great looking sites from Jamie Mitchell, surfacedesigns.com.au

Site Launch: Surface Designs. Built on #genesiswp https://t.co/nRQxvbsb9j pic.twitter.com/T9pxIkDqjD

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) August 5, 2016

…and ballyhoophotography.com

Site Launch: Ballyhoo Photography built on #genesiswp https://t.co/R5mu9hjICZ pic.twitter.com/x2d43QMfEV

— Jamie Mitchell (@jamiejmitchell) August 5, 2016

Brent Passmore for arkansasahecresidencies.com

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, new #genesiswp showcase site from @bpmore for https://t.co/AIhIZWCMU4 pic.twitter.com/MpPT4j0OCw

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) August 3, 2016

James Dalman for lasvegasbikefest.com

I just designed the new https://t.co/NlvCsug5Qr website on #genesiswp and @BeaverBuilder. This was a fun project!

— jamesdalman (@jamesdalman) August 2, 2016

Resa Michelle for toniachisolm.com and cathyanello.com

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, not one but two new #genesiswp showcase sites from @ResaMichelle! pic.twitter.com/9Mo7P5mmxb

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) August 3, 2016

Two new showcase sites on Imagely’s Genesis themes, nicolemontmarquetphotography.com and innerlifephoto.com

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, two new showcase sites on @imagely’s #genesiswp themes for photographers pic.twitter.com/69dYYhRfuI

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) July 29, 2016

Previous GenesisWP.guide guest editor, Tara Claeys with a Genesis / Beaver Builder combo site for twothemoon.com

New website launched! https://t.co/62LzN66IHU #genesiswp @BeaverBuilder

— Tara Claeys (@design_tlc) August 2, 2016

And finally, a 6,000 post, multi-lingual beast of a site by Alexa Dark for abc-mallorca.com

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, this 6,000 post, multi-lingual Genesis site from @alexadark https://t.co/bOLDGxc95C (h/t @wpmusketeer)

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) August 2, 2016

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, two new showcase sites on @imagely’s #genesiswp themes for photographers pic.twitter.com/69dYYhRfuI

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) July 29, 2016

Podcasts

Well looky here, if we don’t have a new podcast all about Genesis from StudioPress themselves, kicking off with their first episode, The Story of StudioPress Founder Brian Gardner. Reckon of you might enjoy that one 🙂

Introducing StudioPress FM — https://t.co/7q0rCvx4al #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/grHQngY6Fg

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) August 5, 2016

Tutorials

The man himself, Brian Gardner, with a tutorial on adding an Instagram feed to your Genesis site footer.

New tutorial: Add an Instagram feed to your site footer — https://t.co/JW6eyXz8wm #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/B6KIfEW3uy

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) August 1, 2016

Jesse on how to Use a Minified Stylesheet with Genesis Themes with Front-Page Customizer Backgrounds.

New #genesiswp tutorial: Use Minified Stylesheet with Genesis Themes with Front-Page Customizer Backgrounds https://t.co/SBoMKr77nE

— Jesse Ⓦ Petersen (@jpetersen) August 4, 2016

Sridhar’s rolling out the tutorials as usual.

Thumbnail Grid with Expanding Preview in Genesis:https://t.co/wMpNWTD4oOhttps://t.co/aBmnme5GE5 pic.twitter.com/tGVF2KqEkQ

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 5, 2016

How to move Secondary Navigation below Slider in Outreach Pro:https://t.co/KwbfqdEWOd#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/xKjnf4PX26

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 5, 2016

Hello! Pro Customizations:https://t.co/ae1kAyXAEx pic.twitter.com/v7JGX3uXHb

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 2, 2016

How to replace Front Page 2 widget area in Altitude Pro with Posts in News layout:https://t.co/5NYNZp1Dfh pic.twitter.com/zz3p4ZcoGl

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) August 1, 2016

How to display Posts in Recent, Popular and My Picks tabs in Genesis: https://t.co/Zp0f9jN4uz

Demo: https://t.co/qXOht1etMa

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 31, 2016

And Chinmoy’s not far behind either.

Filtering the posts by categories #genesiswp… https://t.co/hgDP2pNHrA

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) July 31, 2016

How to display all site categories with their respective thumbnail in grid style? #genesiswp https://t.co/mqZfvGu9qo

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) July 30, 2016

Replacing solid background color with full width background image at home 1 widget area of #genesiswp Centric Pro… https://t.co/Fpig8fIpMH

— Genesis Developer (@genesisdevelopr) August 3, 2016

Best of the rest

Shay Bocks with a great post on six ethical ways to earn money with someone else’s WordPress themes.

Six Ethical Ways to Earn Money With Someone Else’s WordPress Themes https://t.co/oM6apX9SI2

— Shay Bocks (@feastdesignco) August 3, 2016

Brian’s also done around-up of his favourite Genesis food blogging themes (and there’s some good ones).

Are you a food blogger? Here are the best food blogging themes for Genesis — https://t.co/WDH713xu6r via @bgardner pic.twitter.com/IEt1k3um1h

— StudioPress (@studiopress) August 3, 2016

WPStudio’s gorgeous Seasons Pro theme is now fully translatable, including RTL support.

Seasons Pro goes global — Now fully translatable, including RTL support https://t.co/nIAmbvob8j #woocomemrce #genesiswp

— WPStudio (@wpstudiowp) August 5, 2016

Dave Dean releases an update of his starter theme, Musket.

1.3.3 Released of Musket for #genesiswp – https://t.co/9AU6eaj390 – Improves WooCommerce styles out of the box.

— Dave Dean (@wpmusketeer) August 3, 2016

That’s all for this week, have a great weekend, you deserve it.

PS If you enjoyed this week’s update, please consider sharing it with someone who might not have read This Week in Genesis before and let’s spread a little Genesis love together.
